reference.title: Managing Auto-Failover
reference.shortdesc: Auto-failover is managed with with the GET /settings/autoFailover HTTP method and URI.

section.title: Description
section.p: This section provides information about retrieving, enabling, disabling and resetting auto-failover.

row.entry:
Retrieves automatic failover settings. Parameters include:
Enabled=[true|false] : True to enable failover; false to disable failover.
timeout=[value] : Integer between 5 and 3600. Specifies the amount of time (in seconds) that a node is down before failover in initiated.
count=[0|1]: Value is 0 or 1. It shows whether any node in a cluster can be automatically failed-over. After one auto-failover occurs, the count is set to 1 and Couchbase Server does not perform another auto-failover for the cluster unless the count is reset to 0. To failover more than one node at a time in a cluster, perform a manual failover.

Enables and disables automatic failover. To enable or disable failover, use the enabled=[true|false] parameter. To specify the number of seconds that a node must be down before initiating failover, use the timeout parameter.
